title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 22.11 - Direction of banking board
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3 ยง 22.11 - Direction of banking board

State Regulations

The Banking Board, upon recommendation of the superintendent, may direct by a three-fifths vote of all its members that: (a) a trust company file on account of
proceedings covering a period less than 10 years, in accordance with subsection
100-c
(6)
of the Banking Law; (b) any common trust fund be terminated; or
(c) the audit specified by
section
22.17
of this Part be performed by
a Certified Public Accountant. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 3
ยง
22.11

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
